lines.line: I was the fastest cat in town, living life on the edge with my motorcycle and need for speed.
I flexed my muscles and showed off my strength to anyone who would watch.
Then came the crash that changed everything.
I barely escaped with my life, running from the flames that consumed everything I thought mattered.
Surrounded by destruction, I realized I needed to change.
I spent days alone by the window, watching the rain and contemplating my choices.
The old me was gone, and my eyes welled up thinking about who I wanted to become.
I started small, taking careful steps in a new direction.
I enrolled in classes and studied harder than I ever had before.
I learned to type and focused on building a real career.
My education became my priority as I attended every lecture.
I discovered the joy of cooking for myself instead of living on fast food.
I started exercising responsibly, building strength the right way.
I even went grocery shopping, making healthier choices.
I learned to play again, finding joy in simple things.
I reconnected with family, spending time with the younger generation.
I found comfort in the company of others who shared my new values.
We played together and groomed each other, building real friendships.
I welcomed human connection back into my life.
I learned to ask for what I needed instead of taking it by force.
Now I appreciate the quiet moments, just watching the world go by.
Sometimes I still feel curious about everything around me.
But mostly, I'm content to rest in my living room, eyes wide with wonder at how far I've come.
This is me now - peaceful, present, and finally at home with myself.

parsed_script.full_script: I was the fastest cat in town, living life on the edge with my motorcycle and need for speed. I flexed my muscles and showed off my strength to anyone who would watch. Then came the crash that changed everything. I barely escaped with my life, running from the flames that consumed everything I thought mattered. Surrounded by destruction, I realized I needed to change. I spent days alone by the window, watching the rain and contemplating my choices. The old me was gone, and my eyes welled up thinking about who I wanted to become. I started small, taking careful steps in a new direction. I enrolled in classes and studied harder than I ever had before. I learned to type and focused on building a real career. My education became my priority as I attended every lecture. I discovered the joy of cooking for myself instead of living on fast food. I started exercising responsibly, building strength the right way. I even went grocery shopping, making healthier choices. I learned to play again, finding joy in simple things. I reconnected with family, spending time with the younger generation. I found comfort in the company of others who shared my new values. We played together and groomed each other, building real friendships. I welcomed human connection back into my life. I learned to ask for what I needed instead of taking it by force. Now I appreciate the quiet moments, just watching the world go by. Sometimes I still feel curious about everything around me. But mostly, I'm content to rest in my living room, eyes wide with wonder at how far I've come. This is me now - peaceful, present, and finally at home with myself.
